name: Adorimon: Arena of Ancients
description:
In Adorimon - Arena of Ancients, you would be able to adopt and train powerful-but-adorable creatures called "Adorimon". Leveling, feeding, teaching, evolving, there are tons of activities you can do to unlock the full potential of your Adorimons. Prepare a decent team to explore the story, climb Challenge Tower, and duel with other players.
With 130+ species of Adorimons right now, and more will come in the future, guarantee you a pleasant experience of collecting and admiring their unique beauty.




All Adorimon designs are original and can be found nowhere else. They are based on the inspiration of animals and plants in nature, and mythical creatures from various cultures. Each Adorimon has a full 3-stage evolution line, some even have multiple evolution branches, so that you don't get in the situation when your favorite Adorimon cannot evolve like others. All characters are animated thoroughly, making every battle more lively.



Still the familiar turn-based combat mechanic where both sides make their decision, then the faster one goes first, but a lot of new vital things are added.
  • Element interaction: There are up to 15 element types, and each Adorimon can have 2 elements. Knowing the effectiveness of each element against others is the key to victory.
  • Status: effects that may turn the tide. There are a lot of statuses in "Adorimon: Arena of Ancients", from common statuses like Poisoned, Burned, Healing,... to stat changing statuses. They take an important role in the result of a battle, and you can build your strategy focusing on a specific status. There is no limit of how many statuses one can bear at the same time.
  • Moves: Currently there are 300+ moves in the game, and the number keeps rising. A fully-evolved Adorimon can prepare up to 6 moves to use in battle, along with 2 default actions "Normal Attack" and "Defense". This gives you a lot of options to choose from, as well as harder to predict your opponent's action. Each move has its own mana cost and cooldown, so that there is no limit how many times a move can be used in a combat, and some moves cannot be used continuously.
  • Special Abilities: Each Adorimon has a special ability. It can passively enhance a stat, or be triggered in a specific condition and make a surprise for your opponent.
And that's not all. As the game keeps expanding, more interesting mechanics would be added!


Beside the most common ways like leveling and evolving, there are many other activities you can do to make your Adorimons better: rarity enhancing, move tutoring, etc. You can even hunt for relics and resurrect almighty Ancient Adorimons, or breed two different Adorimons to get a completely new species.





Leveling up is the most basic way to power up an Adorimon. When an Adorimon reaches level 15 or 30, you can evolve it.





Once your Adorimon gets to the final evolution form, you can teach it various moves. This allows more strategies available.





If you try hard enough, you can even resurrect Ancient Adorimons from relics. They are very powerful and surely worth your effort.



This is not a pay-to-win game where there are limited contents blocked by purchase wall. In fact, a free player could obtain everything in the game. Gorgeous skins, extremely rare Ancient and Event Adorimons, ... all will be yours if you spend enough time and effort to get them. Doing daily quests regularly, joining in PvP Arena often, and you will have a top team in about 15 days. In PvP battles, it's experience and strategy brings you to victory.
